alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 3:36PM MST until July 15 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Arizona, including the following county, Yavapai. * WHEN...Until 645 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 335 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Stinson Wash, Contreras Wash, Burro Creek, Hyde Creek, Spencer Creek, Humphrey Wash, Turkey Canyon, Apache Creek, Cottonwood Canyon, Horse Wash, Walnut Creek, Little Sycamore Wash, Graver Wash, Hop Creek, South Fork Walnut Creek, Cow Creek, Hitt Wash, Big Shipp Wash, Bear Creek, Conger Creek, Round Valley Wash, Mount Hope Tank, Smith Canyon, Trout Creek, Boulder Creek, Muddy Creek, Pine Creek, North Fork Walnut Creek, Adobe Creek, Wilder Creek, Deep Canyon, Loco Creek and Williamson Valley Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Hope. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
